description.narrative: Output 4.1. Evidence, budget, policy and institutional analysesBy 2020, Strengthened national capacity to provide robust and credible evidence, budget, policy and institutional analyses for children, focusing on reducing disparities and promoting social inclusion., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection â€“ General, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Education â€“ General, Evaluation And Research, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Nutrition â€“ General, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, improved equity-sensitive and child-friendly policies, programmes and budget allocations based on high-quality evidence and strengthened oversight

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.1. Evidence, budget, policy and institutional analysesBy 2020, Strengthened national capacity to provide robust and credible evidence, budget, policy and institutional analyses for children, focusing on reducing disparities and promoting social inclusion.

description.narrative: UNICEF conducted analysis on the economic impact of COVID-19 on vulnerable households and produced evidence that informed high level discussions on social protection options for the Government of Uganda. Budget briefs FY2020/21 completed, and data on off-budget financing has been integrated in the Uganda Equity ATLAS, and the Aid Management Platform (AMP). The FGM further analysis study and corresponding report have been completed. UNICEF surveyed youth aged 15-30 years and found that only 2 out of 5 youth have heard of SDGs and 3 out of 5 had experienced violence in the last two years. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
